review:
The app doesn‚Äôt let me log in, says the username/password are wrong OR the account is locked. Even though the exact same credentials work on the website & I can log in from there successfully. Spent an hour this morning with the support folks, trying to delete, reinstall the app, reset my password etc. and finally it worked - ONCE. Few minutes later, I try again and it gave the same stupid message that the account is locked/password incorrect. Called phone support again and they say my iPhone maybe suspect. Not true‚Ä¶, I have one of the newer iPhone models. And there is no issue with any other app.

Secondly, even when the app worked, it often does not show my prescriptions (‚Äúwe are unable to show, there is an issue right now. Please use the website‚Äù). What‚Äôs the point of the app then? Jesus Christ! I‚Äôve deleted the app now and at peace now. Thanks for wasting my time Anthem.
title: Piece of crap

review:
I loved the Anthem website and used it all the time for Bill Pay with my HSA account. I downloaded this app and now it has taken 3 calls to Customer Service to get this basic task done. I needed to ‚Äòpay myself‚Äô with my HSA to resolve a balance this week with a provider so I can have a procedure done. I went through the normal steps on Friday January 10th. I log in yesterday and it says it was denied although I had more than enough in there. I tried it again, same transaction. Got all the way to the end screen saying ‚Äúsubmitted‚Äù. Checked back about an hour later (typically when I do this, it takes the funds out of my balance within seconds), funds were all still there. I look in pending transactions and my recent bill pay submission isn‚Äôt there. I waited and checked back today- it‚Äôs like it never happened. This app allows you to go all the way to the submit screen, submit it, tells you you‚Äôre all set, but meanwhile is doing absolutely nothing. I called customer service and they were dumbfounded, telling me ‚Äúoh if it said you submitted it then you did but I don‚Äôt see it here. Can you do it on the phone with me now? It should show up in real time.‚Äù
I go through all of the steps for a third time, nothing shows up. No pending transaction. I have no HSA card or time to wait for one to be sent so I may have to move my procedure because of this weird glitch where it won‚Äôt let me do a basic task.
title: HSA Glitches All Day
body:
Hello Hadhighhopes898, we can understand why that would be frustrating. If you could, please email us your Username at Sydney@anthem.com, we want to assist you in getting this reviewed as quickly as possible. Thank you.

~ Sydney ~

review: Tried using the chat with a doctor feature a few weeks back. The robot asks a bunch of questions, asks for your credit card information, then directs you into a meaningless void where nothing takes place or crashes, sometimes both. Then the process repeats. For maximum fun, it charged me for the privilege of being angry at a robot while trying to find healthcare. I called Anthem for support and I am now on call number 2, over an hour in, 2 ish hours combined between 4 people in 3 different departments and we have yet to agree on whether the Sydney app can charge patients in the first place. Does Anthem know they have an app? If so, the people answering the phone to help troubleshoot/refund for the app not working should: A: know how the app works, B: know how to handle customer service calls for the app, C: know they have an app called Sydney that can charge patients for ‚Äúservices‚Äù. I honestly would have chalked this up to ‚Äúcompany started a tech initiative they can‚Äôt/don‚Äôt know how to support‚Äù thing all healthcare providers are up to these days if the customer service wasn‚Äôt sooooooooo baaaaad. Don‚Äôt use it if you can avoid it. Would probably be easier to communicate with Anthem via messenger pigeon or *insert outmoded communication method here*.
title: Just horrible
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. If you could please email us at Sydney@anthem.com with your username and a brief description of what you're experiencing. We would like to investigate this further. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review: Sydney Health is an upgrade to the Anthem Anywhere App. It‚Äôs streamlined and interactive. It can be used at home or on-the-go and with the cute little Sydney interactive helper it makes the app kind of fun to use too. Anthem BCBS has definitely taken consumer feedback and improved their product. If your plan comes with pharmacy then the pharmacy is right there and you can order your scripts through the app as well as set up your auto refill/auto pay. You can save your payment information, view and print your ID card as well as fax or email a copy of your card to your doctor‚Äôs office BEFORE you arrive for your appointment. Finding a doctor is easy, searching claims is easy as well as keeping track of your deductible and out of pocket totals for the year. It‚Äôs got everything. I highly recommend the app.
title: Fantastic & User Friendly
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We're always happy to see our Members having the positive experiences they deserve. If you have any questions, or want to share additional feedback with us, let us know at Sydney@anthem.com. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review: The app it doesn't have details on coverage. You can't find out exactly what is it or is not covered, the amount of coinsurance and co-pays etc. You have to instead go to the full website to get that information. I wish the app had everything and I didn't have to visit the full website so frequently. Also, when searching for care through the app it does tell you who is in network but it does not tell you if they require a referral or a prior authorization. Again you have to go to the full website to get that information. I found this out the hard way when I found an acupuncturist through the app, after my appointment and she told me that her service was not covered by my insurance. I thought that was strange because I had found her through the app, but come to find out I need prior authorization to do acupuncture. I think this could be improved.
title: More information should be included in the app
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Knowing how our Members are using the application, and what features members would like to see in the future helps us improve the app for everyone! If you have any questions, or want to share additional feedback, please let us know at Sydney@anthem.com. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review: The video visit feature is buggy. When I initially clicked on it, it crashed. It finally allowed me to proceed on the third attempt. At that point. I was asked to enter my email address ‚Äì it didn‚Äôt pass via API. When I entered my email address and clicked the button to proceed, I received a pop-up that asked me if I wanted to discard my data. It would only proceed if I clicked yes. When I finally advanced to the scheduling screen, it said it couldn‚Äôt verify my plan. Alright, lots of issues here, but this is what happens when you run a release without testing. Also, I later found out this is just LiveHealth framed into the Sydney app. It would be a MUCH better user experience to just use the LiveHealth app directly - especially if user information doesn‚Äôt pass via api and the user has to re-enter. Right now, it just feels like a broken system.  Framing it in is obviously buggy. As a user, I‚Äôd much rather be told to just download the LiveHealth App. I get the branding angle here, but it‚Äôs not working.
title: Video Visit Buggy
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Knowing how our Members are using the application, and where you faced problems allows us to improve the experience for all. If you could, please email us at Sydney@anthem.com with your username and any error messages you have received. We would like to look into this further. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review: This app is easy to navigate. I haven‚Äôt tried calling any offices to confirm they are in fact in-network; when I do, if there are inaccuracies I‚Äôll revisit this review. One helpful category I wish the app listed is the medical center for which each doctor works. For example, my group of doctors are all under Sutter Health; my records, appoints, after-care summaries, medications, etc. are kept in MyHealth app making it easy for me and my different doctors to see and review. It would be a dream if, when looking for a new doctor, this app listed whether they were in-network and Sutter Health providers. I really appreciate this list of care providers in my network, though, especially therapists, which have tedious to find in my experience.
title: Easiest way to find in-network care

review: This app is pretty handy and intuitive. One thing that was quite confusing early on however was we downloaded the app as soon as we received our insurance cards in the mail (a few weeks prior to our coverage starting). It showed our insurance card in the app and it seemed normal, however whenever I would search for ANY type of provider it showed there were none in my network. After a considerable effort spent by myself and my coworkers, we discovered that the search worked fine if we did it from the website. Ultimately it turned out that the app would not work prior to our coverage starting. It was quite frustrating and wish either the app would be updated or, at a minimum, the paperwork would‚Äôve told us not to use the app until the first day of coverage.
title: Pretty handy
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. If you could please email us at Sydney@anthem.com with your username and a brief description of the searches you had attempted. We would like to investigate this further! Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review: You get 1 star for three reasons: 1) Why on God‚Äôs green earth are you called ‚ÄúSydney Health‚Äù when we are Anthem members in Los Angeles?!?! To get the Anthem app loaded, I had to first figure out that you were called some random name that seems to have ZERO connection to your branding that I‚Äôve ever heard of? Fire the person that decided that idiocy! 2) Fire the App Developer that FAILED to realize that a LOT of us use our iPad‚Äôs for dealing with these kinds of apps, as many of these apps require a LOT of typing - and it‚Äôs FAR easier to use the iPad connected to its keyboard. Instead, you idiots have created an app that will NOT change orientation, so it is UNUSABLE with an iPad. So you would get ZERO stars for that! 3) you offer virtual visits, great. BUT your app and your virtual ‚Äúhelp‚Äù will NOT tell us what the pricing will be on scheduling a virtual visit. Nor does it have any clue what we are asking for when searching for any variation of ‚Äúwhat is cost/copay for virtual doctor visit‚Äù. Ridiculous. Useless app. Fire the lot of you!
title: BEYOND Annoying!!

review: I am completely frustrated with the Sydney Health App. The app downloads to my Iphone and tries to open when I click in it;however it will not open so I can login to my account. I contacted Anthem and was advised to delete the app and reinstall it. I have installed, deleted and reinstalled the app several times and it still will not load or open. P.S. I do not have any type of issues with any other apps I download to my Iphone which is a clear indicator that there is a problem with the Sydney app not my Iphone! It would be nice if someone could fix this bug so I will be able to fully utilize all my Anthem benefits.
title: Horrible App with Issues!

review:
I‚Äôm not really interested in talking to this app. Yes I can see my insurance card and my current medical claims but I cannot see anything about my dental plan at all. The old app used to have both my medical and dental information. It provides the plan benefits but not the actual claims. We used it for dental so I know it should show up there by now. Also, when I search for care and cost finder, my dentist doesn‚Äôt even show up. I was just trying to find her information and I found her before on the old app but now it‚Äôs no results found. 

Also, I have something like a stipend that my job gives me and the old app used to show this and this app doesn‚Äôt show it. I get a lot of contact the hotline messages over information I had access to with the old app. I‚Äôd prefer to use the old app. I might as well just use the actual card and call the number since that‚Äôs what it tells me anyway. I hope this app improves.
title: Doesn‚Äôt have all the info I need
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Knowing how our Members are using the app and what features they're looking for helps us improve the experience for everyone! If you could, please email us at Sydney@anthem.com with your username and we would be glad to look into this further for you. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review:
It‚Äôs nice that Anthem is trying new ideas, but this is one of the worst user interfaces I‚Äôve ever seen, and it‚Äôs very frustrating to use or guess what to do next. 

First, I have no interest in having a conversation with an app. There are a strictly limited number of things this app needs to do: show me my ID card, show me my claims and pharmacy info, show me what I owe and give me a way to pay it without switching to another app, and request a callback to handle anything more complicated. KISS design needs 4 buttons to do the above. The ID card function needs to store the card locally so you don‚Äôt have to be constantly connected to show some office admin your current insurance info. This version makes me guess what a not very well trained AI is looking for and then have an extended discussion with the app to get any useful information while you‚Äôre standing at a window.

Suggestion for developers: make a point to stand on one leg with crutches and no weight allowed on the other foot, or put your arm in a sling with nothing to hang onto while trying to find your ID card without assistance; you‚Äôll get the picture quickly why that this app is not an improvement.
Automatic fail if you fall or unbalance yourself - and then we‚Äôll talk.

The previous version was simple to operate and it worked far better. I‚Äôll use this one since I‚Äôm forced to, but you need to rethink the design.
title: Irritated and going back to a paper card.
body:
Hi Dboyes99, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. If you could, would you email us at Sydney@anthem.com? We would like to speak with your more on this! Thank you.

review: Update-took away a star considering the dashboard does NOT update like it should. I sent an email to the SydneyAnthem email. I have stayed at 5 days of 5k steps for an extra two days despite doing over 5k today & yesterday. I login each night to sync the information. The steps update but the badge info still shows the same number‚Ä¶ Please‚Ä¶please‚Ä¶please‚Ä¶move the dashboard to its own app!! It‚Äôs a great app, but I think it would be nice to have the health dashboard part on its own app. I think having it combined with insurance claims/benefits information overloads it to a degree. Not sure if that has lead to an issue where paper EOBs have gone out despite the fact I have been set to paperless for several years‚Ä¶which unfortunately lead to a financial penalty for paper. There also is not an option on the login of remember my username/password which does not allow for touch ID to be used.
title: MOVE DASHBOARD TO ITS OWN APP!
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us! If you have any questions, or want to share additional feedback with us, please let us know at Sydney@anthem.com. We love to hear from our members! Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review: The app seems nice BUT I am having a great deal of difficulty with figuring out how to deposit money into the HSA account. I added my bank account to the app several days ago. I have not been able to figure out how to validate the bank account from within the app. I gave up and verified my bank account by going to the actual website. Unfortunately, that still didn‚Äôt help inside the app. The app keeps telling me that I need to add an account however it won‚Äôt let me use the same account (because I have already added it). The only thing the cute little seal (Sidney) does is put me back on the same app page. It does not give me any additional information or help and apparently no people are available to chat with except during business hours when I have to work. This is not helpful!!
title: It seems nice BUT‚Ä¶
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We would like to discuss your experience further with you. If you could please email us at Sydney@anthem.com with your Username and a brief description of what you encountered. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review:
Screen rotation - Not supported. Only portrait mode. Not good when using a keyboard.

Login screen - I need to context switch to pick up name and password from my pwd manager. Tool prevents context switching from keyboard (cmd+tab). When context switching with home button, this app deletes anything typed into name and password fields. This forces me to type name and password, which is not at all secure, as people can see what you are typing if you are in public.

Plan Usage Screen - Some silly little symbol (Sydney ?) on lower right corner of screen is covering the last entry under Claims.

Plan Usage Screen - Claims Screen - Lack of useful information. There are $ amounts with no description.

Context Switching away from the app for a couple seconds results in a forced-logged out.

Buttons pop up in arbitrary and inconsistent places. For example,  I had an error messages appear at bottom of screen. To cancel out of it and make any forward progress, I had to hit a little cancel button that appears at the top/center of the screen. What is this Whack-a-mole ?

The web site works better.
title: My impressions after first use of S/W on iPad... immature
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. If you would please reach out to us at Sydney@anthem.com with your username. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review: So far it‚Äôs a pretty decent app. It‚Äôs nice using the health dashboard and getting little tips on health and fitness. And being rewarded for being active and healthy as well. The reason I gave it 4 starts is because there is a feature where you can speak with a doctor over video chat, but every time I tried using the link to connect to one it would not work. Luckily I was able to see a doctor the next day, but with kids and the longer waiting time it takes to see doctors lately, it would have been very nice to have had access to video chatting with a doctor online. So hopefully in the future that feature of the app with be fixed and able for me to use if needed.
title: Good app

review: App Doesn‚Äôt provide the most basic info like nearby pharmacies in network (defaults to 50 miles - this is hardly nearby to anything. In my area I probably have 50 pharmacies within 3-5 miles but this app shows up with ‚Äúdoh we can‚Äôt find anything‚Äù) Hides basic usability items such as enter on login and has too much of their own pictures and content prioritized over the user‚Äôs basic questions. If you hit one of those screens you can‚Äôt get out and have to close and reopen and login again. Anyway tried using it two years ago and haven‚Äôt since but this latest update is, once again, a complete waste of my time - making any current symptoms worse. This app is not good for my health. Anthem‚Äôs online services are not good for my health. But obviously they are not a healthcare provider- they are an insurance company. That‚Äôs two different things
title: Horrible and useless

review: When I first got my new insurance I logged into my insurance site and there was a big banner with a link to download Sydney Health. I clicked it and logged in about four times over the first week. Then all of a sudden this message ‚Äúsomething went wrong‚Äù kept popping up. So I called the number from the message (just over 1hr on the phone) and they said they would look into it. They messaged me and said I shouldn‚Äôt have access based on what they found. Just on a whim I checked the login and lo and behold I had access again. Color me confused but I was happy because I had an upcoming dr appointment and needed the access because I misplaced my insurance card. Day of appointment came and I went to log in and again ‚Äúsomething went wrong‚Äù. Why can‚Äôt I access something that I was directed to and understood was part of my insurance benefits/features. Such a headache.
title: Maybe or maybe not
body:

review:
Awful user experience start to finish. Information is unclear or nonexistent. In addition to the design looking a decade old, it isn't responsive either. Words run off the screen in many random places. The actual service flows to connect to doctors (in any of the ways offered) are terribly designed - severely prioritizing a company's myopic desire for maximum data at the expense of understanding the patient's need, sense of urgency, and where this attempt to connect with a doctor fits into their overall health situation. It's like you're interacting with a V1 wireframe that was concepted without any customer-centric thinking or understanding of standard UX practices in 2022. It's a joke this is supposed to be a trustworthy, legit and valuable health entity. 
Overall I'd say the fact this app is acceptable/publishable from the insurer's perspective is concerning enough that I'd prefer to switch insurers.
title: Poorly Concepted, Poorly Designed

There is no explanation and I keep getting locked out.    They always changed my password and even the correct one doesn‚Äôt work.   How can I pay my bill because by the way their website is also garbage and just looks like an html error page from geo cities in 1997.

I manage software development teams (Agile) in my company and I know the type of business/user testing required before an app or version is released.  I‚Äôm assuming that an update in soon to be released.  If not, this would be a hard fail.

userName: no way my name is gone
review: I am very upset by the service I received from Sydney Health! I used the ‚Äútext a doctor‚Äù service, because it seemed like a great option after my 2 sons were diagnosed with bronchitis by their pediatrician, and I had developed the same symptoms. It seemed like the perfect alternative to finding a babysitter for my sick babies so I could go to the doctor myself. It was not! It was a complete waste of time and money! I spoke with 2 different doctors that both ignored my concerns and gave generic, yet conflicting, answers. After I googled the doctors, I saw that many people had the same experiences! I was very disappointed by the arrogance of these doctors! In addition, I found it very difficult to express my complaint through my Sydney Health account, and was refused a refund even though the last doctor I spoke with told me to go to an urgent care and that she could not help me.
title: Very dissatisfied

If you could, please email us at Sydney@anthem.com with your username. We would like to look into this further. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review:
I have used this app ever since its launch, and on the whole it‚Äôs very handy. Having a digital ID on hand and quick access to my HSA details are really appreciated, and while it occasionally has some server hiccups that manifest in blank screens and errors, most of the time it has suited my needs and gotten the job done. 

The developers are actively improving the app regularly, as well ‚Äî my original review was pretty scathing, but they reached out to me shortly after and informed me that the technical issues I had faced had been solved, and indeed they have been. If you have Anthem coverage, this is a nice utility to have on your phone.
title: EDIT: Very handy app that works well most of the time

If you have any questions, or want to share additional feedback, please email us at Sydney@anthem.com. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review: I give 1 ‚≠êÔ∏è for app being what it says it is. And I give 1 more ‚≠êÔ∏è for it offering a variety of ways to input and/or find information. But that‚Äôs it‚Ä¶ the info I‚Äôm getting is mostly irrelevant to me. When asking for a PCP in general/family medicine, why would I (as a cis male) need the slew of OB/GYN referrals that come up, along with half a dozen other specialties? And why is it that the window for conducting searches (or for displaying options on a map) is so small, and the headings of that section of the search process takes up 80% or more of the phone screen? It looks like I‚Äôll need to skip using this app and do all my searching on a desktop computer, which raises the final question: Why did I bother using this app? It‚Äôs extremely frustrating to try to navigate.

If you could, please email us at Sydney@anthem.com with your username and a brief description of what you faced. Would like to investigate this further. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review: Someone referred to this app‚Äôs 5-star reviews as ‚Äúastroturfing.‚Äù I wasn‚Äôt familiar with the term, the definition seems very applicable to this app. There is no way this app could have received so many legitimate 5-star ratings right out of the gate (many of which were curiously grouped largely during the period from Aug 30 to Sept 3). Then the tone changes during Oct-Dec where 1-star ratings are much more common than any others. Was this app even beta-tested? The standard response from the developers is ‚Äúwe will continue to release upgrades frequently to provide users with an even more robust and enjoyable user experience‚Äù followed by ‚Äúplease provide us with specific examples of problems you experienced so that we can address them.‚Äù That really should not be necessary. Users should not be forced to serve as beta-testers; that should be done pre-release.
title: No way the 5-star reviews are legit

review: Overall app is lacking, coming from the Engage app which was much more intuitive and user friendly. Sydney Health app doesn‚Äôt always sync with my Apple Health data (steps and Sleep time). It always misses 2 days of a seven day week. Yes, I do log in every day to the app and it will show ‚Äúno data‚Äù for my steps and sleep, even thought my Apple Health data has my steps and sleep time. I always click on the refresh button but that doesn‚Äôt change the result, it remains ‚Äúno data‚Äù. Must be bad coding. This issue has been happening since I started using the app months ago. Since this seems to be a syncing issue with the app, maybe let users manually input their daily steps and sleep time since your app doesn‚Äôt seem to work/sync consistently with Apple Health.
title: Sleep and step tracking doesn‚Äôt always sync

review:

The app now tells me I can‚Äôt a receive text or email notifications because you don‚Äôt have me email of phone number and I have to contact my administrator to add it. How did I sign up and sign in with no email or phone number? So I tried to close the app and reopen it. Now it says there‚Äôs an error with my account and the ‚ÄúSign in‚Äù button no longer works. What kind of sick joke is this app?

After more attempts, I was able to sign in and add my phone number and email. Still leaving a 1 star because wow is this app broken.
title: A sick joke
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. If you could, please email us at Sydney@anthem.com with your username and a brief description of the errors you experienced. We would like to look into this further. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review:
I just showed my colleagues that I can see my insurance card AND COVID-19 Vaccination card right in the app and they were amazed and thrilled and went to download the app for themselves.
I order my prescriptions on this app AND it includes coupons for various prescriptions (when available) so I can save money.
I have also used the chat feature to talk with a representative quickly rather than wait on the phone.
I love that my benefits are clearly listed too.
This is such a help for someone like me who seems to lose everything.  Thank You Sydney!

review:
This isn‚Äôt a good app. I‚Äôm not sure how it can have so many good reviews.  Internal customers?

I can‚Äôt even reset my password. Also, Where it asks for member ID, the iPhone is inserting a strong password suggestion.  Then, authentication doesn‚Äôt work properly with Touch ID.

I was on the phone 5 times today just so I could get a very very basic piece of information. The last person kept me on hold for 20 minutes checking on something. Then the line dropped.  Before that, The line was bad, and rep promised to call back and never did.  Wasted a whole morning.

review: Ok you guys are not CIA or NSA. Why would you lock my account after one failed attempt and direct me to call your help desk? Apple (like always) sends useless ‚Äúupdates‚Äù, knocking out saved passwords and credentials, having users scrambling to retrieve the right password that may result in a few failed attempts‚Äî and you guys exacerbate the situation with a ‚Äúsingle-fail-lockdown‚Äù policy. Even US govt websites like Social Security and DHS allows upto three attempts and so do a lot of secure banking apps. Please change this extremely annoying feature. I don‚Äôt use the home delivery service because the meds come late and the service doesn‚Äôt contact my doctor for refills unless I ask them to, so much for auto refills.  I end up paying a little more to my local pharmacy for better support as well as supporting local jobs.

The price comparison tool would seem helpful but it compares home delivery with a 90 day supply with local pharmacies 30 day supply.  Not much of a comparison.

About 70% of the time the app will tell me that pharmacy comparison access isn‚Äôt currently available.  So what‚Äôs the point?

At the end of the day, unless my insurance covers the prescription 100%, I just use GoodRX.  Much cheaper.

review:
After Anthem updated their website for two-factor authentication, I cannot even login to the Sydney app. There is an error message popping up that ‚Äúa threat has been identified‚Äù and I need to call their phone number. I can login to the website without any problems, but the Sidney app is utterly useless. 

I called their phone number and the technic person tried to find out what happening but could not identify the problem. They entered a ticket telling me that I would get an email to resolve this issue. Nothing happened.

Under these circumstances, Sydney Health is completely useless. Zero stars.

review:
Downloaded the app, entered my membership info successfully and then it asked for my vaccination card. 

The app has an inbuilt camera capability, however, despite many attempts, it ‚Äúcan‚Äôt read‚Äù my card. So I tried asking the in-app chat and it thought I was asking for my Anthem card, and duly sent me an image of that card!  What!

Next I tried chatting with a live agent called ‚ÄúAlexander‚Äù who was very slow and finally, after maybe half an hour, said he could only help with policy issues and gave me an 800 number to call. 

The 800 number had a recorded message saying the wait time would be over 30 minutes.  

So I went back to the App Store entry and touched App Support. Well, that provides only policy support and not app support. 

Based on this experience, I can‚Äôt recommend this app. It‚Äôs an unsupported time-waster, not a time-saver.
title: First Impression bad. Poor app with poor support

review:
This app has always given me problems logging in and staying logged in. 
When logging in, often it takes so long that the network times out prior to logging a person in.
Once logged in, after several attempts, it will only leave you logged in for a few minutes of inactivity. So if you pull up your ID card for your doctor in the waiting room, once they ask you for it, you will discover that you have timed out and need to start over. 
Please fix these chronic issues. 
Thanks.

Currently ripping my throat out trying to get a video appointment with a doctor so I can get a visual diagnosis on my strep throat and get the ball rolling on some antibiotics- though the app simply does not allow me to use this feature.

1) upon selecting Video Visit I am asked to enter a number
2) enter number, get into infinite loop of ‚Äúsomething went wrong.‚Äù leave app and try again. 
3) now on the ‚ÄúEnter Email‚Äù prompt. I enter my email and am met with one of 3 errors: to leave the page and discard; to use another email (??); and to try again.
4) farthest I‚Äôve gone is a drop down for my location and ‚ÄúDependents.‚Äù This page never loads. 

I‚Äôm beginning to think this feature simply isn‚Äôt implemented. Even the prompts/errors foretell a bit of laziness on the dev‚Äôs part in terms of error handling. There‚Äôs nothing specific and the grammar is off.

review:
The list of issues is painfully long, but it can be summarized by the fact that their website, when accessed through this app via the tabs at the bottom, claims that the ‚Äúbrowser‚Äù isn‚Äôt supported. 

The live chat was useless. It started, and then over about 10 minutes they provided one incoherent sentence that was useless and barely even conceptually related to the question.

Then there‚Äôs the fact that you don‚Äôt just log in to the app. It‚Äôs heavily powered by web views and fails to keep you logged in. Then subsequent logins don‚Äôt always work.

I suppose for the bare minimum of accessing critical information, it might prove moderately helpful, but the initial experience has done nothing to generate any confidence that the app is useful or trustworthy. Given the amount of bugs and lack of reliability, it‚Äôs kind of scary to trust this app with any personal information.

Why is everything a password field? When I‚Äôm typing my email address I want to see it so I‚Äôm sure I didn‚Äôt make any typos. Also iOS trying to suggest a ‚Äústrong password‚Äù for the answer to my security questions is not helpful.

Speaking of passwords, the iOS strong passwords don‚Äôt work for your system, because they contain hyphens. You should either figure out how to disable that function or accept hyphens in passwords.

Lastly, the form was constantly scrolling up and down as text boxes appear and disappear whenever I tapped on a text field or typed something. Just very annoying, and it‚Äôs the first thing a user sees.

If you have any additional questions or want to share more feedback, please reach out to us at Sydney@anthem.com! Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review:
Junior varsity mobile app team. Circa 2001.  Horrible UI and experience. Nothing related to ‚ÄúCovid vaccination‚Äù in CA?  There is this thing called ‚Äúelastic search‚Äù. Check it out. 

Scrolling left to right on a mobile app to look at most requested items? Seriously? Fire that Dev. 

Seriously. This is like a web app masquerading as a mobile app.  You sent me to a website when I asked for Covid vaccinations?  

Your bot is crap. Which means your data pipelines are garbage. All pre-canned responses. No ML here.  Garbage app. 

Btw, Sydney, the name, is not intuitive to ‚Äúanthem‚Äù. Fire head of marketing at anthem.
title: Fire the entire team that built this mobile app

First issue: app says it supports apple wallet, but while you can "download" your i'd card, it doesn't say where got downloaded to. It's not in the wallet, nor documents folder. 
2nd: pressing frequent asked questions does nothing...
3rd: asking online live person is frustrating, as they don't seem to know the app, or what an apple wallet is....
4th: there is nothing one can look at related to one's plan, they all report "information not available"
.......
title: awful
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share what you're looking for in the app. The Anthem Health Pass feature will coming soon for the iOS Sydney Health app, this feature will allow you to store ID information to Apple Wallet! Currently if you download your ID you can access it from the Sydney Health application before logging in by going to the Menu, then "Saved ID Cards". If you have any additional questions or want to share more feedback, please reach out to us at Sydney@anthem.com! Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review:
The only reason I downloaded this app is so I can avoid having to carry my ID card in my wallet. 

After logging in, my ID card came up correctly, but it is soooo small that is very difficult to read.  There is a zoom button, but it does very little. This is so easy, how can you mess it up??

Also, the name is terrible. With dozens of apps on my phone, I usually search by name. How am I supposed to remember ‚ÄúSydney‚Äù as the name of the app to access my Anthem card?  

Come on, people.

review:
I was able to register successfully using my membership ID, which seems to indicate that the app should know what my plan is. However, I cannot view my plan information. Instead, it gives me an alert telling me to go to the Anthem website. The ‚Äúfind care‚Äù feature is also broken for the same reason. It will not allow me to search because it cannot find my plan. After visiting the Anthem website, I noticed the find care feature there is the exact same page as what is loaded into the app. It‚Äôs broken there for the same reason too (cannot find plan), but unlike the app I can actually view my plan information on the site. Neither bug makes much sense and the alert to ‚Äúgo to the website‚Äù is not only rude, but nonsensical since the app is already loading pages from that very same website!

About the security issue, I don‚Äôt know what high school student was hired to write the registration forms, but I am a highly experienced app developer myself, and those forms appear to have been written by a greenhorn. Literally every field on the forms is obfuscated like it‚Äôs a password field, but at least there is an option to de-obfuscate the inputs. Form validation also seems to kick in prematurely, but doesn‚Äôt seem buggy. Password restrictions here are the absolute worst- not because they are too strict, but oddly enough, they are not strict enough. I attempted to put in one of my most secure password combinations which is over 20 characters long and includes special characters, but is was rejected as not secure until I put in what is probably one of my LEAST secure passwords! One last thing, it‚Äôs good that I de-obfuscated the email address field because I typo‚Äôd it initially and apparently there is no email address verification email sent.

This app appears to be a hastily slapped together hodgepodge of an existing buggy website with only the thin veneer of an app placed on top of it.
title: Bugged out, practically useless, and bad security

review: I love the idea of this app, but there are big problems.  1) if you want to chat with a doctor, you wait for hours and then if you are in the middle of something when it is your turn, you lose your opportunity. The time predictor is wildly inaccurate by hours.  And because of the way it notifies you (see more about that later) you might not even get a timely chance to join the doctor in the app for the appointment.  2) the doctors depend heavily on the camera app, which is horrible. My phone has 4 cameras, but there is no way to switch to the zoom or wide angle camera and there is no way to force the flash.  Even if you have somebody else to take a photo for you, and even if they have a flashlight to sub for the flash, it can still be impossible to get a photo that is meaningful to the doctor. 3) there are numerous dead end screens when there is no way to exit a screen other than by closing the app and starting over. 4) when a new message comes in from your doctor, they text your emergency contact instead of you. 5) messages are terribly delayed in the app. The doctor sends you a response, your emergency contact gets a text, and 15-30 minutes later, the message shows up in your app. 6) this means that you may spend days instead of minutes communicating with the doctor and waiting to see if they can help - the whole time, you are not feeling well and the cure could be minutes away if you could just have a few moments of prompt communication. 7) the symptom checker isn‚Äôt great. If you type something in that it doesn‚Äôt recognize, there is no way to register that symptom. You end up abandoning symptoms that the app doesn‚Äôt recognize. Some of the follow up questions have possible answers that are not listed. 8) after your visit, you are asked how it went. The doctor was okay, but the app was frustrating - but that‚Äôs also not a feedback option.
title: Helpful but frustrating

review:
When it works it seems to do well.  Finding providers, seeing claims, checking some coverages, and even the Sydney AI.  Problem is that 75% of the time when we need it something is not working.  Usually driven by an update that needs to happen or one that broke something.  My wife and I now just laugh because it is never working right.  We know now when something isn‚Äôt working you need to update the app.  Then when it still isn‚Äôt working right you need to wait a few more days as another update will happen a few days later.  

Problem is when you are on the road and only on cellular then it is not so easy to update the app.  Slow data rates and uses too much data. 

Latest example:  was working fine for about a few weeks - we were shocked - which was good as were in the middle of care.  Then I go to log in today and ‚Äúa something has gone wrong.‚Äù  I update it and now it fails sending a code.  ‚ÄúOops something went wrong‚Äù and ‚Äútoo many tries‚Äù or something like that.  Now I just have to wait for another update.

Agile, fail-fast, etc is all good with SW development but you still do need to test it with additional updates being the exception and not the norm.

One other pet peeve on this app - could you please support landscape mode.
title: Never works when you really need it‚Ä¶

review: This program continuously logs me out. Over the last three years, there‚Äôs always ‚Äúa problem‚Äú and there‚Äôs no way to log back in for 30 days. I have the correct login information and every now and then it will let me in, but it is so inconsistent and so rare it‚Äôs been nothing but a hassle. When a text code is sent I‚Äôll enter the text code and it will be wrong and log me out or keep me out for weeks. I‚Äôve deleted this app for good.

review:
I‚Äôve had an issue recently where I could not pay my plan premium at the beginning of the month. When I was finally able to do so, the app had doubled all of my premiums. In the past, I was able to call and have this resolved with the billing department with no issues and it was fixed within a day. 

This month (August 2021) when I called, the billing department told me last week that I was being billed for October and that I could only pay the premium over the phone by giving out my credit card number which I was not comfortable with as I did not trust who I was speaking with and based on the fact that they insisted that I pay over the phone instead of correcting the mistake in the app to keep my account up to date.

It made no sense as the app would still reflect a passed due notification for a bill that was for the future, not September‚Äôs bill but October‚Äôs bill! 

They told me they would contact their technical support‚Ä¶ when I called back this week (last week of August) I spoke with the same person as last week who told me it was September‚Äôs bill this time that was being applied early (after going over the issue with her again) and when I told her that 24-48 hours may be too long to resolve the issue and insisted on paying through the app, she stopped talking. When she finally started talking again, she told me no one had entered any details in the report to technical support (meaning she didn‚Äôt do what she said she would). She made me wait for a supervisor, then transferred the call to someone else who admitted they were working off shore.

Couldn‚Äôt tell if I was being scammed at this point (based on the conversation and what I‚Äôve seen on YouTube on how people scam people through computer hacks) and the supervisor would not help me out either.

As I mentioned before, I was behind on my payment but in the past the double billing was resolved. This time it wasn‚Äôt. Not sure what to think of Anthem‚Äôs billing department at this point but having noticed the change in billing procedure (doubled in the app) and the change in how they would accept my payment over the phone only, I believe there is a potential that my app and/or account information was not in good hands.
title: Constantly being billed for next month before the current month ends
body: Hello, thank you for sharing your experience with us. If you could please email us at Sydney@anthem.com with your username and reference this review. We can understand your concerns and we would like to investigate this right away. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review:
I would give this app zero stars if it were an option. Customer support via the messaging is the worst I‚Äôve ever experienced, and I‚Äôve tried at least 10 different requests over two years. They don‚Äôt read your question, but rather they send a generic response that has nothing to do with the original message. Additionally, they expect you to scroll through about 500 ‚Äútopics‚Äù to try to find a relevant one before you can send a simple question through the message feature. 

They‚Äôve now added a ‚Äúvaccination card‚Äù feature with no method to upload my vaccination information, which was received through my employer. 

Additionally, when I search for in-network providers, it almost always defaults to a location that‚Äôs a 31 hour drive away despite my using location services AND inputting my actual zip code repeatedly. 

Price estimates are a joke, and need significant improvement and more information. 

Terrible user experience.

review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for a few months - it‚Äôs a step in the right direction, but this app as well as Anthem rewards have lots of bugs.

Here are the issues:
1. The app doesn‚Äôt work with VPN. You have to disconnect from VPN to use the app. If you try to login with VPN, the SMS code request will error out which is required for login.
2. The app doesn‚Äôt automatically sync steps, sleep, and other health info from Apple Health. You have to login and manually click ‚Äúsync data‚Äù. Even then, it doesn‚Äôt always sync or it only works for steps. Sleep and other data never sync for some reason although I allowed those data points in the settings.
3. The app might stop launching on iOS 14.4 for no reason. Literally, I woke up one day and it crashed upon launch every single time. Restarting my iPhone didn‚Äôt help. I had to delete and reinstall the app to make it work again.
4. I submitted the app feedback to the address provided in the app 2 weeks ago. Never heard back, not even some sort of acknowledgment.
5. ‚ÄúMy Health Dashboard‚Äù doesn‚Äôt show points or any useful info you‚Äôd see on desktop (like activity, point history etc). Moreover, points for activities are not added correctly - the integration with Lark app is broken and half of other activities don‚Äôt add points as advertised (i.e. points for average number of steps per week, WebMD assessment, Lark etc).
title: Fancy UI, but many improvements are needed
body: Hello, thank you for sharing your experience with us. Knowing what issues our Members are seeing helps us create a better experience for everyone. If you could, please email us at Sydney@anthem.com with your username and a brief description of what was happening when the app crashed. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

title: Can‚Äôt log in

review:
To preface this, I have no issue with anthem insurance, they‚Äôve been nice to work with over the years.

This app is unusually poor quality. The app name doesn‚Äôt work even have the word ‚Äúanthem‚Äù in it; so finding it when the website was down to download my card was difficult. Then you get to the login page and just see ‚ÄúSydney‚Äù with no indication that you can use your anthem web login. So I thought to create a new account. When I did that, there isn‚Äôt even a control to add birthday to registration form nor can I copy paste it from somewhere else. So I went back to login with anthem credentials which worked. 

Once I was inside the app, I needed to download my insurance card to iCloud Drive so I could send it off to somebody who needs it. So I clicked the ‚Äúdownload card‚Äù option. All that does is save it to the app? You can‚Äôt use the iOS share panel nor can you save the card to iCloud Drive: you can only email or fax(???) it.

This app is incredibly poor quality for 2020. It feels like a pile of Accenture crap that probably cost anthem tens of millions of dollars. Developers - you should be ashamed at the quality and experience of this app. Anthem, I know it‚Äôs expensive but please try to hire a better, USA based development firm to improve your mobile experience
title: Unusually bad quality
body: Hello, thank you for taking the time to share what you're looking for in the app. The Anthem Health Pass feature will coming soon for the iOS Sydney Health app, this feature will allow you to store ID information to Apple Wallet! Currently if you download your ID you can access it from the Sydney Health application before logging in by going to the Menu, then "Saved ID Cards". If you have any additional questions or want to share more feedback, please reach out to us at Sydney@anthem.com! Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review: At first blush, this seems like a game aimed at 6 year old girls.  What‚Äôs up with the fish thing ... do I really need this creepy ‚Äòguide‚Äô to navigate several simple tasks: get my digital ID card, find a doctor, verify benefits, check payments, troubleshoot with an Anthem representative?  Here‚Äôs are my quibbles: (1) There is too much code for what should be a very simple streamlined app; (2) the pastels are heavy handed and the interface is juvenile. It harkens to Apple‚Äôs decision to dump skeuomorphic icons for its widely panned pastel replacements; (3) there are one too many ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù push screens that interrupt self-directed work flow. In short, this app way too busy and over-thought for what it should be. This app is like the guy who speaks paragraphs when a short sentence would do. The old app worked fine, this one not.

review:
The app seems to work fine. But it‚Äôs really strange that a majority of the text is in camel case (likeThisForExample) as if the app is displaying variable names from the code. It‚Äôs seriously everywhere. 

Example 1) 100% of the text in the menu screen off the login screen is camel case:
‚ÄúmenuScreenTitle‚Äù
‚ÄúmanageHealth‚Äù
‚ÄúfindCare‚Äù
‚Äúsupport‚Äù
‚ÄúcontactTechSupport‚Äù
‚Äúfaq‚Äù
‚ÄúaboutApp‚Äù
‚ÄúappVersion‚Äù

Example 2) Many of the pop-up messages, like when you click ‚ÄúfaceID‚Äù before logging in, have OK buttons that read ‚ÄúokButtonTitle‚Äù

Example 3) The Claims tab

Example 4) The Menu tab

This doesn‚Äôt affect the performance of the app, really, but I‚Äôd personally feel better using a healthcare app with normal text.
title: camelCase?

If you have any questions, or want to share additional feedback with us, let us know at Sydney@anthem.com. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review:
Clearly a new app recently developed and rolled out to consumers without proper quality control.
1: every time I log in it asks if I want to use touch/Face ID. I select yes every time, confirm in the settings, and yet it still asks every time. 
2: keyboard doesn‚Äôt allow password keychain (see login problem above)
3: when trying to search for providers, it claims one of two errors. First it says it cannot find my plan and redirects me to anthem‚Äôs website from within the app to login yet again. Upon logging it, it still says it cannot find my plan. 
Without logging in and trying to search care via the plan # I manually input, the Second error states that I have more than one plan which is why certain pages do not load (I do not. I have only one health plan like 99.99% of people). 

This app needs a serious backend overhaul!
title: Lots of bugs needed to be worked out
body: Hello, thank you for the time you took to provide this feedback. Knowing how our Members are using the application, and where they are facing issues, helps us improve the application for everyone. If you could, please email us at Sydney@anthem.com with your username and we would be glad to look into this right away. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

review:
All I want is a summary report of payments made for all my premiums in a calendar year and a summary report of my out-of-pocket payments to doctors, etc. for the same time. Those data should be easily accessible through the website and app using filter options and report exporting, like every other bank and credit card service I use, yes? 
Not so much. Not at all. 

It took a several phone calls, first to the app people then to the customer service center. That was the first 15 minutes. Once I got to someone who could help, she had to create the report while I waited. It took more than 50 minutes. Then she had to send it by email using a secure link. She did not have the correct instructions for me to open it; then put me on hold for another 15 minutes during which our phone call dropped. Got disconnected. Never to be connected again. 

I got the email eventually and was able to open it, but it only had a fraction of the data I wanted (just the medical premiums, but I carry vision and dental too.) And we never even got to the payments for services report. 
Of course, I was speaking with someone who had an Indian accent, and of course, they can‚Äôt give you their direct line number, so to get what I want, I‚Äôd have to go through the whole thing again?? I think not. 

SOOO FREAKIN‚Äô MADDENING. I should have the capability to access that information by myself without through the portal anyway, yes? Why is that not possible?What else is the portal used for?? I‚Äôve had no other use for it. 

And, of course, I am a single-payer, self-insured person with limited provider options. So this means I have to just accept this level of poor customer service?!!? Just so wrong. I pay close to $12,000 in premiums + out-of-pocket costs every year for health coverage. Do better. Please.
title: Simple Request Not Simple
body: Hello, we can understand how not being able to access the information that you need would be frustrating. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, knowing how our Members are engaging the application, and what they want to see next helps us improve the application for all of our Members! If you have any questions, or want to share additional feedback with us, let us know at Sydney@anthem.com. Thank you. ~ Sydney ~

title: Care and cost finder
body:
Hello First Wazup, thank you for sharing your feedback. If you could, would you send us an email at Sydney@anthem.com with your username? We'll get something assigned to support right away, or provide you with an update if you have an open ticket already! Thank you.

~ Sydney ~

review: I downloaded the app and tried logging in but it didn‚Äôt work so I went to forgot username and answered the security questions CORRECTLY. It gave me an error message 5 times and then using the SAME answers it finally went through. Then I get to the reset password page and the same error message is showing no matter what I choose the password to be. I am following the password rules and it still won‚Äôt work. It‚Äôs telling me to call customer service which is only available only M-F. For WHAT?!? To create a password? I‚Äôm more than sure i am capable of creating my own password. Useless!
title: USELESS
body:
Hello DNJ1991, we're sorry to hear that you had such a negative experience getting started with Sydney. We can understand why that would be frustrating. If you could, please do reach out to us at Sydney@anthem.com and we'll take a look at this with you. Thank you.

~ Sydney ~

review: This app has a great look and feel and is quick and responsive. Usually healthcare apps are slow and clunky and seem to be using technology that is ten years old or older. This app brings healthcare into the 22nd century and compares favorably to other tech centric apps from Uber, Amazon, and eBay.
title: Best healthcare app ever!
body:
Hi patriotsfan16. Thank you for your glowing review! We are working hard to make it the best experience for you and our members. If you have any suggestions you'd like to share, please contact us at Sydney@anthem.com.
~ Sydney ~

review: Don‚Äôt bother. No info here that isn‚Äôt on the anthem website.  I spent 10 minutes arguing with a bunch of code about why I don‚Äôt have access to a cost finder tool.  Yes, I feel shame.
title: Absolutely Useless
body:
Hi rmbreviewsstuff, thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We're sorry you had a negative experience, that's not what we want for any of our Members. If you could, please send us an email with your username to Sydney@anthem.com? We'll take a look at what's causing your access issue. Thank you.

~ Sydney ~

review: Missed opportunity so far - try to find Urgent Care and you are sent to Medicare.gov - try to price a drug even worse. Doesn‚Äôt seem to know I have both anthem supplement and part D.  I know this app is new so 2 stars for a crippled app.
title: Sketchy app
body:
Hello Frediam912, thank you for sharing your experience with us. We're always looking to improve how Sydney Health can make your health journey easier. If you could, send us an email with your username and we can take a look at why only some of your coverage is showing. Thank you.

~ Sydney ~

review:
I downloaded Sydney but I‚Äôm unable to pay for the Health Insurance starting Jan. 1, 2020. It only shows my plan that‚Äôs expiring 12-31-2019. 
I‚Äôve called Anthem several times but have never been able to talk to a representative. How do I pay the monthly payment for the plan starting Jan. 1, 2020?? When will the new plan beginning Jan. 1, 2020 be on the Sydney app??
title: Member
body:
Hi 1PatB , sorry to hear you're having issues viewing your coverage, we can understand why that would be frustrating. Please reach out to us at Sydney@anthem.com with your contact information so that we can take a look at this for you.

~ Sydney ~

review:
Update: after all the problems below, pharmacy function would not work.  Stuck on loading preferences.  Hours later it worked, but on all options clicked within it say "Yikes. You are not allowed to use this functionality".  Sorry to sound so negative, but this has been a very bad experience.

Original: Got a new phone and needed the Anthem app.  Searched the app store, nothing came up searching Anthem but an Anthem app for Kentucky and some other small states.  Hmmm.  Accessed anthem.com, had to log in and then was presented with a new app called Sydney.  Clicked to get it, but Chrome repeatedly blocked the popup.  Clicked chrome option to always allow, still did not work.  Ok, manually opened the app store and finally found it searching Sydney.  Downloaded.  Anthem nowhere in the app name.  Now when I need my Anthem app in a hurry at the doctor's or at the pharmacy, I have to remember the name Sydney to find it.  Dumb on so many levels.  Hard to find, difficult to get due to links not working between web and app store, and will be less useful due to non-anthem name.
title: So many dumb ideas
body:
Hi peakay2002, thank you for your feedback and sharing your experience. We plan to update the app frequently to continue to try and make your experience better. You sharing with us allows us to do just that. 

~ Sydney ~

review: Tried to recover username. Won‚Äôt let me by ‚Äúanswer the security questions‚Äù but there are none!
title: Can‚Äôt sign in with my anthem username
body: Hi Jimvernon! We believe we have found the problem and resolved it with the latest update to the app. If you are still having issues, please contact us at Sydney@anthem.com and provide your username so we can ensure this is resolved. ~ Sydney ~

review: this is not a real  no star for making people pay upfront with 6k bills before it work as an insurance we already paying monthly why we need upfront payment in case of emergency you would not treat a fellow soldier for his injury without payment shame on capital america
title: trash
